trans-unit.source: Specifies processing rules or option settings for a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlReader"></xref> implementation.

By default, an initialized XamlReaderSettings object uses values for its properties that correspond to expected defaults, such as `false` for Boolean properties or null values for reference-type properties.
Default initialization results in the following values: - The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.BaseUri%2A> and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.LocalAssembly%2A> properties are `null`.
- The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.IgnoreUidsOnPropertyElements%2A> property is `false`.

- The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings.ProvideLineInfo%2A> property is `false` in the object model; however, it can be set to `true` at run time based on the loaded executables and their debug settings, or by XAML schema context.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings"></xref> class.
For more information about initialization of a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings> default instance, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings"></xref> class based on values in another <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings"></xref> object.
This constructor supports the merging of settings for XAML readers where additional settings can also come from other participants in the reader process.
An existing <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings"></xref> object.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the root object may include members that have a protected code access model when it reports the XAML type representation.

This setting is relevant to some XAML implementations such as WPF where the root object is often a "factory" for generating an instance from a pattern type, when that pattern type is not always a practical object instance.

For example, a root of `UserControl` has a certain meaning for WPF and Silverlight application models, and `UserControl` might have protected properties (`UserControl.Content`) that the parser needs access to.
Tools and design surfaces also need access to such properties.
These cases should generally be reported to the XAML type system as writable properties even though they have protected access in the backing type system.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the root object may include members that have a protected code access model; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the base URI that is used to resolve relative paths.
Some URI-related properties in the .NET Framework XAML Services API treat URIs for XAML namespaces as strings; however, this property uses the true <xref:System.Uri> type.
The base URI to use.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the XAML reader should ignore values for <xref uid="langword_csharp_x:Uid" name="x:Uid" href=""></xref> attributes that exist on property elements.
During localization, the `x:Uid` attribute is used to identify elements in markup so that localization tools can process XAML elements as discrete entities for localization.
Attributes do not usually appear on property elements in XAML.
However, `x:Uid` is an exception because some usages put localized text in a property element as content, instead of as a separate object that can receive its own `x:Uid`.
Setting an IgnoreUidsOnPropertyElements value to `true` enables a stricter mode.
The default value of `false` continues to process property element `x:Uid` attributes.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the reader should ignore values for <xref uid="langword_csharp_x:Uid" name="x:Uid" href=""></xref> attributes on property elements.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the reader should process <xref uid="langword_csharp_x:Uid" name="x:Uid" href=""></xref> attributes on property elements.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the object that represents the current local assembly for processing.
This assembly information is used for calls to helper APIs such as <xref:System.Xaml.XamlType.GetAllMembers%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A CLR reflection <xref:System.Reflection.Assembly> object.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the reader can provide line number and position.
ProvideLineInfo is `false` in the object model; however, it can be set to `true` at run time based on the loaded executables and their debug settings.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the reader can provide line number and position information; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the reader enforces that all <xref uid="langword_csharp_Value" name="Value" href=""></xref> nodes are processed as a <xref uid="langword_csharp_String" name="String" href=""></xref> type.
In addition to <xref:System.String>, a possible `Value` content under some XAML implementations is <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XData>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the reader enforces that only <xref uid="langword_csharp_String" name="String" href=""></xref> is contained in <xref uid="langword_csharp_Value" name="Value" href=""></xref> nodes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
